alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:14PM CDT until May 17 at 7:13PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Burleson and Lee Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Middle Yegua Creek...including Dime Box...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...From late tonight to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 27.0 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 05/30/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 21.3 Sat 8 pm CDT 26.3 27.0 26.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
